results.title: Risks and wrongs (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Risks and wrongs” explores risk-taking, or illegal activities such as stealing or vandalism, and peer pressure among teenagers. Includes hints and advice from teenagers, police and other adults on issues such as being assertive; saying ‘no’; image amongst peers; friends - real or otherwise; actions and consequences; responsibility. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Risks and routines
results.creator_credit: Epilepsy Foundation of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Aimed at carers in Community Residential Units (CRU), this short program provides practical advice on how to care for epilepsy sufferers. It outlines the importance of record keeping, routine, medication maintenance, treatment for status epilepticus and the recognition of independence. Features “Barry” (performed by Doug Pentland) a CRU resident and drawings by Dorothy Berry, as well as comments from epilepsy sufferers who explain what it feels like to have a seizure and what can trigger an attack. Contains footage of a tonic clonic seizure. Please note this video is not intended to function as a formal training guide and doesn’t contain a manual as stated on the tape.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Epilepsy Foundation of Victoria and Open Channel Productions

results.title: Risks and reasons: HIV and intravenous drug user issues ...
results.creator_credit: Kestrel Films & Video (Australia), Victoria. Dept. of Health. Health Promotion Unit and STD Unit of the Health Department Victoria
results.brief_description: Designed to provide health professionals with information regarding the potential risks of HIV transmission via intravenous drug use and outline the Health Department Victoria’s response to the public health threat. Presents the rationale underpinning the IVDU/HIV Prevention and Management Strategy through interviews with experts, user advocates pharmacists and needle exchange staff. Role plays the use of needle/syringe exchange programs addressing the implications occuring when staff do not advise clients correctly and others where users are given appropriate information and access to new equipment.

results.title: Risk factors
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, National Heart Foundation of Australia, Suatu Film Management and Mediacast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help yourself to health”.
Focuses on the main risk factors in coronary heart disease: prolonged high blood pressure, smoking, excessive fat in diet leading to elevated blood cholesterol levels.

results.title: Risk and resilience
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Time to grow”.
Examines the psychological effect of child abuse on development as an on-going risk. Therapy for abused children and counselling for parents is included.

results.title: Risk & resilience
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Examines the tension between risk and resilience and looks at specific developmental risks and the social, family interactional and person variables associated with resilience. The lessons of classic studies and contemporary projects across America are examined.

results.title: Risk
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Hugh Burton and Christian Bernardi
results.brief_description: Follows the adventures of lovable anti-hero Looi Fresco as he searches for love in a big city. Dressed in a lime green suit his experiences and insights allow him to move beyond the confines of self expression and eccentricity as he shares 11 minutes of sheer risk with us.

results.title: Risk
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, James Carr and John Haggarty
results.brief_description: An insurance broker, with his knowledge of his client’s activities, can assess all potential situations and knows where to place the risk at the most economic premium. Told in story form, this explains the work of a Broker in Britain and illustrates his involvement with individuals and industries.
